net.sf.click.extras.cayenne
Class RelationshipSelect

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.click.control.Field
      net.sf.click.control.Select
          net.sf.click.extras.cayenne.RelationshipSelect
All Implemented Interfaces:
Control, Serializable
public class RelationshipSelect
extends Select

Provides a Cayenne data object Relationship Select control:   <select></select>.

Relationship Select
The data object primary keys are uses at the values for the Select. The labels can be rendered using a provided Decorator or will render the primary key value otherwise.

The example below add a RelationshipSelect for the department property of the Person data object. 

 RelationshipSelect departmentSelect =
     new RelationshipSelect("departmentSelect", "Department");

 departmentSelect.setDecorator(new Decorator() {
     public String render(Object row, Context context) {
         return ((Department) row).getName();
     }
 });

 SelectQuery query = new SelectQuery(Department.class);
 List departmentList = getDataContext().performQuery(query);
 departmentSelect.addRelationshipList(departmentList);

 CayenneForm form = new CayenneForm("form", Person.class);
 form.add(departmentSelect);
 form.addRelation("department", Department.class, departmentSelect);
PLEASE NOTE: this control is undergoing preliminary development and is subject to significant change

Author:
Ahmed Mohombe
See Also:
CayenneForm, Serialized Form

RelationshipSelect

public RelationshipSelect()
Create a Relationship Select field with no name defined, please note the control's name must be defined before it is valid.

No-args constructors are provided for Java Bean tools support and are not intended for general use. If you create a control instance using a no-args constructor you must define its name before adding it to its parent.

Method Detail

addRelationshipList

public void addRelationshipList(List relationshipList)
Add the given list of data objects to the select. The data object values will be converted into Option objects and added to the select. The data object primary key is used as the options value, while the provided renderer is used to render the option label.

Parameters:
relationshipList - the list of data object which will provide the select options

getDecorator

public Decorator getDecorator()
Return the option label rendering decorator.

Returns:
the option label rendering decorator

Parameters:
decorator - the decorator to render the select values with

isEmptyOption

public boolean isEmptyOption()
Return true if an empty value is a valid option.

Returns:
true if an empty value is a valid option

setEmptyOption

public void setEmptyOption(boolean emptyOption)
Set the empty value option flag. If true the option will render the first select value as empty.

Parameters:
emptyOption - the empty option value flag
